timeline.message:
Add utility classes to deal with RLP encoding / decoding of transactions.
- Added `TransactionRLPDecoder` with `Transaction decode(RLPInput input);` method.
- Added `TransactionRLPEncoder` with `void encode(Transaction transaction, RLPOutput output);` method.
- Added `TransactionRLPEncoderDecoder` with 2 static methods:
    - `static void encode(final Transaction transaction, final RLPOutput output)`
    - `static Transaction decode(final RLPInput input)`
- Updated `Transaction` class to use `TransactionRLPEncoderDecoder`.

Signed-off-by: Abdelhamid Bakhta <abdelhamid.bakhta@consensys.net>

Merge remote-tracking branch 'upstream/master' into 1364

timeline.bodyText: Why can't this switching logic go inside the encoder and decoder classes?
timeline.author: RatanRSur

replies.bodyText: You think this extra class does not bring any value ?
replies.author: abdelhamidbakhta

replies.bodyText: It looks like the Decoder doesn't use any of the special fields. Could the ENCODERS map go straight into TransactionRLPEncoder?
replies.author: RatanRSur

replies.bodyText: Yes. Ok nice suggestion, it will simplify the design even more
replies.author: abdelhamidbakhta

timeline.bodyText: Trying to understand this. No matter what the RLP is we decode it as an eip1559 transaction if that's enabled? We don't need to do any checks on the decoded rlp to see if it's a legacy tx?
timeline.author: RatanRSur

replies.bodyText: There is no proper way of knowing in advance. Basically you try getting more fields and you guess the type based on when the end of list is reached.
replies.author: abdelhamidbakhta
